intro: Eriodictyon californicum subvar. coarctatum, commonly known as California yerba mansa, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its aromatic, rough-textured leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its medicinal properties. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in chaparral and coastal sage scrub habitats. Its unique botanical features make it an important species in local ecosystems.
